info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Steuben, northern De Kalb, southwestern Hillsdale, Williams and west central Fulton Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hamilton, or 7 miles northwest of Butler, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Butler and Hamilton around 755 PM EDT. Edon around 805 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Montpelier, Pioneer, Holiday City and West Unity. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 329 and 346. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 151 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
